results.title: Prairie wings
results.creator_credit: Edgar M. Queeny and Ducks Unlimited
results.brief_description: Each year sportsmen from many parts of America visit the flooded marshlands of Arkansas Grand Prairie in the quest for wild duck which abound in this region. Sportsmen are seen in action using artificial duck calls and decoys to assist the hunt. Much of the film is photographed in slow motion using telescopic lenses.

results.title: Prahran the city
results.creator_credit: Russell Hurley and Prahran College of Technology
results.brief_description: Fourteen students from Prahran College of Technology in Melbourne collaborated on this project demonstrating a practical application of film school workshop production. Numerous aspects of the City of Prahran are blended together to create a film on suburban community using a probing television documentary style. Captures the changing style of business, once quiet, now busy since the influx of migrants; shows the ‘Feedwell Foundry’, the now defunct Realities gallery and the ‘Station Hotel’; traditional and modern architecture is represented in this city with examples of mansions, high rise accommodation and buildings by Roy Grounds. Community centres, a market and an extensive public transport network contribute to the city’s popularity which has attracted a large Greek population. Originally established as the Mechanic’s Institute in the 1860’s, Prahran College of Technology offers courses in business and art & design. The range of places available for work, rest and play all contribute to Prahran’s vibrant atmosphere.

results.title: Practising headsprings
results.brief_description: A demonstration of training methods for performing headsprings. Introductory shot of clowns doing headsprings in the circus ring. The remainder of the film is photographed in a gymnasium; an expert gymnast demonstrates practice movements for different parts of the activity and shows how these parts are combined in the complete headspring.

results.title: Poultry on the general farm
results.brief_description: Intended for farmers, this film illustrates the advantages of keeping poultry on the farm. It deals with selection and rearing, housing management, feeding.

results.title: Post script to empire
results.brief_description: Tells the story of two places, the Isle of Dogs region of London and the recently-built town of Stevenage 30 miles away, the old and the new. Shows Britain trying to come to terms with a world far different from that which it knew before World War II.

results.title: Positioning for Function Workshop
results.brief_description: Seating and positioning for handicapped clients is thoroughly examined in this video and careful attention is given to designing equipment which meets, as fully as is possible, the individual needs. Such attention to design assists in maximising function.

results.title: Portraits: people with epilepsy
results.creator_credit: Samantha Shepherd, Donna Graham and Epilepsy Queensland
results.brief_description: Five people from different walks of life talk about their experience with epilepsy. Hugo Weaving tells of how it affects/doesn’t affect his work as an actor. Retiree Jean reflects on her life as an epileptic mother. Chef Ian addresses how he adapts his work in a stressful job to accommodate his condition. Uni student Sally talks about what it was like to study, then travel overseas, and primary school teacher Amanda explains how her students cope in the classroom. The five talk candidly about their achievements and how epilepsy has affected their lives. Funded by the Health Advancement Branch of Queensland Health and produced for Epilepsy Queensland.

results.title: Pork on the farm: killing, curing and canning
results.brief_description: Details the best methods for raising pigs for home use (as distinct from marketing them) are given; correct slaughtering methods are shown; the general principles which give nest results in cutting up pork are demonstrated; and detailed descriptions of carious ways of curing pork.

results.title: Pooling around
results.creator_credit: Paul Galan and Continental Oil Company
results.brief_description: Looks at a van pool commuter program established by the American firm Conoco. With the aim of energy conservation, employees commute to work in a van. Shows the beneficial aspects for the company and the employees.
